title.narrative: Consolidation of National Public Management Information Systems

description.narrative: The objective of the proposed operation is to improve the transparency, coverage, operation and interoperability of key national financial management information systems that will allow Government decision makers to link performance measures with planning, budgeting and other managerial actions.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Operational Manual Approved | Description :Completed before project effectiveness | Due Date :04-Jan-2010

title.narrative: The percentage of DGCPTN staff that is required to use the new information system, and effectively does so, has increased from 0% to 100%
Decrees and other legal norms to promote efficiency and effectiveness have been drafted

baseline.value: The legal framework requires inefficient procedures; oversight of budget execution is oriented towards compliance rather thaneffectiveness and efficiency

target.value: Documents with proposed adjustments to the legal norms that regulate the budget process have been drafted

title.narrative: Tools for managerial decision-making, budget monitoring and evaluation are available.

baseline.value: Tools and information systems oriented towards process administration and not for managerial decision making. Insufficientinformation for managerial decision making

target.value: Budget execution information is on-line and consolidated as a tool of information and communication, with digital dashboards fordecision making.

actual.value: Information of budget execution is available online and consolidated as and information and communication tool.

title.narrative: 100% of consolidated budget information (at the level of individual entities) is published online on a monthly basis within the first week of the following month.
SIIF-Nación implemented throughout of the central administration (i.e., 63 AU within the central administration and 100 AU in decentralized entities)
Number of pending obligations (compromisos) normalized has increased from 0 to 540,000
The average number of physicaldocuments required for customsclearance has been reduced from 12to 5
The number of instruments that the DGCPTN is able to register in the system has increased from 15 to 25
The number of methodologies and processes designed for front middle and back office operations has increased from 2 to 10
The number of high-impact DIAN procedures that have been modernized has increased from 20 to 40 (100%)
Gap between required and actual competencies has been gradually reduced

target.value: annual increases in a scale of 1-5

actual.value: annual increases in a scale of 1-5

title.narrative: Time lag to produce aggregate financial data for the central government, including decentraslized entities, reduced from up to 35 days to 1 day.
Average time to clear customs decreases from 48 hours to less than 8 hours
The ration between programmed budgetary resources for investment projects and requested budgetary resources for investment projectshas increased from 81.6% to 92%
The ration between the number of investment projects programmed and the number of investment projects registered has increased from86.8% to 90%
A Monitoring and Evaluation system is in place

baseline.value: No mechanismsin place to ensurequality andefficiency ofMHCP'smanagementpractices

title.narrative: Studies have been conducted on the economic and social impact of alternative social security reform alternatives

baseline.value: limited capacity to carry out in depth and strategic studies

title.narrative: Studies have been conducted on the economic and social impact of global warming

baseline.value: limited capacity to carry out in depth and strategic studies

title.narrative: Carry out pilots integrating data generated by the different goverment systems
Full interoperability of Nacion with SECOP and Public Debt
Full interoperability of SIIF Nacion with the following systems PAGOS (Banco Republica) SILOG (Defensa) and SOBRETASA (MHCP)
Carry out pilots allowing the disaggregation of expenditure information
SIIF and SUIFP information on the allocation and execution of budget items is fully consistent
Certification of quality has beenobtained for SUG
Plan for the Implementation of Decree 28

target.value: Plan for the implementation of Decree 28

actual.value: Plan for the implementation of Decree 28

title.narrative: Number of studies completed to strengthen fiscal and macroeconomic planning
Tax administration efficiency increases, as reflected by an increase in the ration of total tax collection/DIAN's executed budget from 103.2 to 103.7
Number of Systems Services (Servicios InformÃ¡ticos ElectrÃ³nicos), transfered to DIANâ€™s technology area increases from 12 to 40
Improve DIANâ€™s National Transparency Index from 81.25 (2007-2008) to 89.51 by project closing.
Information on budget execution#i.e., revenues and expenditures#that is available daily increases from 85% to 100% of the total amount of the National Budget (Presupuesto General de la Nación # PGN)
Progress on development of virtual learning program for improving technical capacity of DIAN staff

The DGCPTN's integrated management system, SEIGI, is fully operational. No other treasury & debt management system is in operation within the DGCPTN (the current debt system is maintained temporarilly
